eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: Jessica refuses her family's protection and chooses to head to the frontier with Woodrow.

attributes.content: The war's over, Woody. You're free. You can go back to Laterano, to that small house your parents left you, and plant roses in the front porch.
attributes.name: Rupert

attributes.content: Then, you can find a chapel nearby and paint them on its ceiling, so they can listen to the prayers of every visitor. That way, the sounds will drift you into a peaceful night of slumber.
attributes.name: Rupert

attributes.content: I found your gun in the warehouse, but... not his. Bring it back with you.
attributes.name: Rupert

attributes.content: What about you? Where are you headed?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I'll stay here.
attributes.name: Rupert

attributes.content: In Columbia...? But the war's over.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Your war may be over, Woody, but mine has only just begun.
attributes.name: Rupert

attributes.content: Woody. Hey, Woody...
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Ugh...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Are you alright?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: How long have I been out...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Three days.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: The kids got pretty tense when they saw me injured, so they went a little overboard. You banged your head on the staircase when they shoved you to the ground, and were out like a light.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Where's Jessica? And the others...?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Don't worry, she's fine. And I've sent someone to escort Helena.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: My guess is she'll reach that casino unscathed in half a month. Then she'll launder all the money there before handing it to Sylvia, who's already waiting in the frontier.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...You aren't going to pursue them?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I told you already. I only care about what's in the contract. The higher-ups asked me to tow the plate to the specified location and maintain order on the way.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: It doesn't say a thing about what happens off the plate, so I don't care either.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I may be a cold-blooded monster, but even I don't like feeding on the flesh and blood of others.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: So what're you gonna do with me?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I have a mansion in southern Columbia. Got a great, big greenhouse. Wonderful place.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You could change your name and enjoy your golden years there. I'll make all the arrangements.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You ever lived there?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Never. But that's what the real estate agent said.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...Thanks for the offer, but if there's one thing I know, it's you never trust a real estate agent.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If you ain't turning me over to the courts, then I'm leaving.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: To find your friends?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: To find my family.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Your gun's on my desk. The last convoy to the frontier is in half a month.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You could...
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Go ahead, take the call.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Would you like some tea, sir? Thank you so much for coming all this way.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Uh, thanks, Miss Brynley. Your family paid a lot of money to hire me, so naturally I'm at your beck and call.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: Robbing a bank is a serious crime... It's going to be tough to win this, isn't it?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Depends on what outcome you're hoping for.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: If you don't mind prison, we can get you the shortest possible sentence in the most comfortable environment, and once you're released, your record will be clean. No one will even remember.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: We do this all the time. It's nothing difficult, so long as you can afford it.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: Okay. What else?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Of course, not a lot of people enjoy the sights of a prison cell. We have an alternate plan for you. You could stay home under house arrest, or even go on vacation at some villa with a great view.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: Under supervision, of course.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: Would that be difficult for you?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Yes, but not especially so.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: If you don't want to spend a day in prison, and would rather go back to a normal life right away, like nothing ever happened... That would be quite difficult, but not impossible.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: ...In Columbia, aren't most criminals sent to the frontier instead of prison?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't worry, Miss Brynley. With us on the case, things won't get nearly that dire.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: No... I'm saying that's what I want.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: I should be out there. I broke the law, and that's the price I should pay.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And you expect me to tell that to your father? Personally speaking, that's probably the most difficult thing you could ask of me.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: No... the most difficult thing would be to try and stop me.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Because that's outright impossible.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You're... pretty determined.
attributes.name: Travel-Stained Lawyer

attributes.content: You're right, I am. More than I've ever been.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Not taking the call?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I've never told anyone, but I hate phone calls. Loathe them.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I can tell. With that frown, you could hold a piece of paper between your eyebrows.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Is it that obvious?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: But yes, every time my phone rings, I have to suppress the urge to draw my gun and shoot the damn thing.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I've thought about it so, so many times, but every time I've managed to swallow it and answer.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: It's just a phone...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Try spending two months with it on the battlefield. It changes everything.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: You're on call from sundown to sunup. When you pick it up and the voice says, 'attack,' you've no choice but to obey and send your men charging into enemy lines.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Then, you fight from sunup to sundown. You bring back everyone you have left, but before you even have time to catch a breather, the phone rings again.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: The voice says, 'hold the line,' and you have to send everyone back to the frontlines to keep fighting a never-ending battle.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Let's part ways here, Woody. If I lost my right to give a eulogy at your funeral years ago, then I hope you'll at least hear out my last request.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I'm listening.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Don't die in someplace I've never even heard of.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...Fine. I have some parting words for you, too.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Yeah?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: If you can't go back to how things were, you can at least hang up and call back later. Don't let them force you to keep your eye on it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I hope you'll always remember this phone call.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: He picks up the phone on the desk and punches in a few numbers
Is this the president of the bank? Hello, sir. I was a little busy, and couldn't answer your call.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Right, we ran into some trouble during the towing. I understand your frustration, but to me, as long as the plate reaches its destination, the mission will be a success.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Everything else is a sideshow. No one's going to care.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Right, I understand. The money is very important to you.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I get that business has been on the rise, and the people from Trimounts could help you climb even higher. And now that the money's gone, my guess is they won't just let you off the hook.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Of course, I also realize you aren't worried about them. You're worried about the higher-ups, who are even harder to deal with and can truly decide your fate.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Yes, I understand. I understand all that.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: So, what do you say I help you fill in the hole? It's no small sum, but nothing I can't afford.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: In return, perhaps you could help me with a small favor.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I have a few documents that I'd like you to sign for me. Under the table, as it were.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Someone's knocking on your door? Perfect, sounds like my mercs have arrived with the papers.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Haha... You're afraid to sign?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: But think of our partnership. This is a win-win.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: I'll give you another call in half an hour. I hope you'll have made your decision by then. Talk to you later.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Come in.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Sir, the money is ready. We're just waiting for the bank's decision.
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: But I must say... Taking over that platform in Bolívar took a whole lot less work than this one.
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: Well, that's Bolívar.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Bolívar doesn't have cutting edge scientists, nor any tech companies jostling for control of all the abandoned plates they can get.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Not to mention the favorable prices for plates and ownership transfer procedures they have there.
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: They wouldn't mind getting on our good side, after all.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Alright. No more complaining about things not going to plan.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: If peace is a string, then the tighter it's stretched, the more the ones holding the ends will want a knife to cut it with. But as soon as it's cut, you either get rid of the knife immediately, or hold onto it forever.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: We've been stretched too tight for too long, by someone much stronger than Bolívar.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Who knows how many more Davistowns we'll have to handle? I'd rather get the big guy to loosen his grip. Or even show him how much it hurts when the string snaps.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: But an old platform they wouldn't think twice about... Hm, this might be even more useful than we thought.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: If we consider only the immediate impact... the security of the surrounding areas could be greatly improved once we've established the training centers in Bolívar and Eastern Columbia.
attributes.name: Secretary

attributes.content: Of course. If we didn't care about that, then what separates us from the guys who only know how to grease palms... No, what separates us from the 'big guys'?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Well, that's all a problem for the future.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...It's the bank president again. I suppose it wasn't a difficult decision.
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: Care to listen in?
attributes.name: 'Clip' Cliff

attributes.content: ...Why do we have to set sail now, of all times? I wanted to see Jessica and Woodrow off.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Stop whining and pack your clothes.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: You left them all over the floor... Tsk tsk.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: How come you two are so calm about this? Who knows if we'll ever see her again, once she's out on the frontier.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Mr. Cliff didn't approve her resignation. So even there, she'll still be a member of Blacksteel.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: What? B-But... She's going out there to serve her sentence...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Yes, correct. But with her identity as a Blacksteel employee... and the job.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: ...The job?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Right. No matter where you go, you can never escape this job.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Maybe we'll get a mission in the frontier one day, and we'll get to see her.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Now hurry and pack your clothes.
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: I... I can't believe you two were keeping this from me. I thought I'd never...
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Don't blame us. Blame Engineering for keeping you so busy that we never got a chance to talk.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Hm? What's this...?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Something wrong?
attributes.name: Liskarm

attributes.content: Oh, no. I just found a note in my pocket.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Big whoop. Call me when you find a blank check.
attributes.name: Franka

attributes.content: Half a month ago, Laura wore that coat while bidding her friend farewell with a hug.
She slipped a note into her friend's pocket, but didn't notice her friend doing the same.
Laura turns away from the other two and opens it up.
There are a few numbers and a sloppily scribbled message:
'If you ever need funding, give this number a call.'
Another one.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Ma'am, you've been in this pub all night. The owner is about to close up.
That's alright. I know the owner.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Are you waiting for someone?
Nah, I ain't never waited for no one my whole life.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Is someone waiting for you, then?
Yeah...
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Will they get to meet you?
I got a lot of people waiting for me, you'll have to narrow it down.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Let's not worry about the distant ones. The closest, waiting for you right now.
Yeah, of course they will. Gave 'em my word.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: It's hard to find someone who takes promises so seriously these days. Here, let me treat you to a round.
You tailed me this long just to buy me a drink?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...Believe it or not, I made a promise too. I promised the girl you're supposed to meet that she'll get to see you.
You can call me Tila.
In a swath of scorched earth, I see a spark light up and drift with the wind into the distance, before perishing into ashes.
Or perhaps it lit up the night sky and brought forth the daylight.
You really plan on coming to the frontier with me?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You know what it is you're throwing away?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I do.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: It's a stupid-ass choice.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Maybe in a few years, a few months, or even a few days... I'll come to think the same.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But I can only decide with the heart I have now.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If I think it's worth a shot, there's no reason for me not to act.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You think you'll find what you're after out there?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Before... I always put all my effort into chasing things I could never reach.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: When I was a kid, I tried to chase my siblings, who were all taller than me. When I was a teenager and my grandfather died while I was out of the country, I rushed to attend the funeral I could never have made it to in time.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And then, after I grew up... I chased disasters and conflicts I could never possibly stop. Again and again.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'm always chasing, but I never make it in time.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But this is different. This time I'm not chasing anything.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Because I'll be there from the very beginning.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Then let's get going. Hope you're ready for a fresh start.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Why the tears, Jessica?
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: My castle fell down. I spent all afternoon on it, but now there's nothing left.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica, you built your castle on the beach. Of course it'll fall down when the waves come crashing.
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: I'm so dumb... Why didn't I build it somewhere safe...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What kind of nonsense is going through your silly little head? You're my granddaughter, how could you be dumb?
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: But my siblings are all so much smarter... They know all these things I don't...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: They're adults. Of course they have more experience than you. When you grow up, you'll be just like them.
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: But won't they be even more amazing by then?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Huh... How come you have so many weird questions?
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: Sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Now now, don't be so upset... How about I rebuild your sand castle with you?
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: Will you really...? But even if we do... it'll still come crashing down because of the waves tomorrow.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: In the end... There still won't be anything left...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica, if you're so worried about the waves wrecking your castle, how about we pick a beach further from the water, and rebuild it there?
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: Even when you lose everything, there's always the future... and we need to believe in it.
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: Don't be afraid to start over.
attributes.name: Grandfather

attributes.content: Yeah... Let's start over.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: A warm hat is placed on the girl's head. Its brim is so wide, it covers almost her whole face.
If you want to cry, cry. You've been through so much... Must be tough to bear.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I'm not...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Ain't nothing to be ashamed of, Jessica. New lives always start in tears.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: It's the very first step toward breathing.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: After a long silence, a sob can be heard from under the hat.
The old man doesn't look down. Instead, he turns his gaze to the far end of the snowfield.
The sky beyond the horizon is dyed red by the dawn clouds, and its bright light reflects off the crystal-clear snow.
The vermillion hue stings his eyes with a sharp pain, and his tears begin to well up.
